articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a gift from the visiting photo exhibition delegation of the Far Eastern Region of the Russian Federation.
 Olga Malteva, head of the delegation, conveyed it to an official concerned.

articles.title: Greetings to Libyan Secretary of General People's Committee of Libya
articles.content:
Greetings to Libyan Secretary of General People's Committee of Libya 
    Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Hong Song Nam, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Shukuri Muhammad Ghanem, secretary of the General People's Committee of the Great Socialist People's Libyan Arab Jamahiriya.
 The premier in the message extended the warmest congratulations to him on the occasion of the 34th anniversary of the Great September First Revolution in Libya and wished him greater success in his responsible work for the development of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Libyan Foreign Secretary
articles.content:
Greetings to Libyan Foreign Secretary 
    Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a message of greetings to Abdulrahman Mohamed Shalgham, secretary for Foreign Liaison and International Cooperation of the General People's Committee of the Great Socialist People's Libyan Arab Jamahiriya, on the occasion of the 34th anniversary of the Great September First Revolution in Libya.
 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future and wished him greater success in his responsible work.

Greetings to Nigerian Party
articles.content:
Greetings to Nigerian Party 
    Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea on August 30 sent a message of greetings to the National Executive Committee of the People's Democratic Party of Nigeria on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of the party.
 The message extended the warmest congratulations to the National Executive Committee of the party and all the party members on the occasion.    
 Firmly believing that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties and two peoples would strengthen and develop in the future in the idea of independence, peace and friendship, the message sincerely wished them greater successes in their activities to strengthen the party and achieve the national unity and prosperity and the regional peace and stability.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Uzbekistan
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Uzbekistan 
    Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Sunday sent a message of greetings to Islam Karimov, president of Uzbekistan, on the occasion of its independence, the national holiday of the people of Uzbekistan.
 The message extended warm greetings to the president and the people of the country on the occasion.    
 Expressing belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would favorably develop in the future, the message wished the president greater success in his responsible work for the prosperity and stability of the country.

DPRK-China Agreement Inked
articles.content:
DPRK-China Agreement Inked
    Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- An agreement of the 42nd meeting of the DPRK-China Committee for Cooperation in Border River Transport was inked here on August 31. Present at the signing ceremony were members of the delegation of the DPRK side and that of the Chinese side to the committee.

articles.title: Day of Non-aligned Movement Observed
articles.content:
Day of Non-aligned Movement Observed
    Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The non-aligned movement has invariably made a long drive over the past 42 years and this is a result of its firm adherence to the idea of anti-imperialism and independence and the fundamental principle of non-alignment, says    
Rodong Sinmun today in a signed article.   &nbsp
 It goes on:   &nbsp
 If the non-aligned movement is to maintain its noble idea and fundamental principle and increase its influence, it should, first of all, direct the sharp edge of its struggle against the U.S. imperialists' strong-arm and arbitrary practices and unilateralism. When the non-aligned countries got united and put up a tough struggle against the U.S. imperialists' strong-arm and arbitrary practices and unilateralism, the latter would not ride high and mighty and a great progress would be made in accomplishing the cause of independence and peace. When the non-aligned and developing countries crop feathers of the U.S. imperialists with their united force, international relations based on sovereignty and equality will be established without much difficulty and the democratization of the international community be accelerated.   &nbsp
 If the movement is to fulfil its mission as a powerful anti-imperialist independent force, it is very important to achieve the unity of action in the movement.   &nbsp
 The United States is deliberately fanning up differences among non-aligned and developing countries in a bid to largely broaden them and lead them to collision and disputes. The non-aligned and developing countries should heighten vigilance against these moves of the imperialists and take joint steps and unity of action in the anti-imperialist and anti-U.S. struggle.   &nbsp
 The non-aligned movement should expand and develop south-south cooperation to cope with the "globalization" schemings of the imperialists.   &nbsp
 The DPRK, as a dignified member of the movement, will as ever remain loyal to the idea and principle of the movement and make energetic efforts for its development and victorious advance.

articles.title: Broad-spectrum Sterilizer Developed
articles.content:
Broad-spectrum Sterilizer Developed
    Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Researchers of the Centre of Basic Science under Kim Il Sung University have developed a new kind of broad-spectrum sterilizer.
 It, belonging to the best kind newly set by the World Health Organization, does good in sterilizing all sorts of bacteria and virus, eliminating offensive odor and in bleaching.
 With this sterilizer sewage can be purified within three or four minutes and used for drinking. So it is popular not only in economic sectors but among mountaineers, explorers and campers.   &nbsp
 It has no harmful effect on human body.   &nbsp
 The researchers have also made a portable producer of the sterilizer without sources of electric power and heat.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Apologize for Its Crimes
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Apologize for Its Crimes
    Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The Japanese government should thoroughly probe the truth about the massacre of Koreans during the Kanto quake of 1923 and all other crimes committed by Japan against the Korean people, open them to the public and honestly apologize and adequately compensate for them, declared a spokesman for the DPRK Measure Committee for Demanding Compensation to Comfort Women for the Japanese Army and the Victims of Forcible Drafting in a statement on  August 31 80 years after the Japanese imperialists' massacre of Koreans during the Kanto quake. At least 23,000 innocent Koreans were killed by a brutal method baffling human imagination during the Kanto quake on September 1, 1923, the statement said, and went on.
 The Japanese government has not yet properly probed the truth of this incident, far from feeling any guilty conscience and responsibility for the massacre, though 80 years have passed since then.   &nbsp
 The frantic anti-DPRK rackets and unceasing violence and threat to Korean residents in Japan remind one of what the Japanese reactionaries did 80 years ago to "exterminate Koreans."   &nbsp
 The issue of redeeming the crimes committed by Japan against humanity serves as a touchstone showing whether its talk about human rights, civilization, humanitarianism and law-abidance is true or false.   &nbsp
 The committee will surely force the Japanese government to probe the truth of all the crimes committed by Japan against humanity and apologize and compensate for them and thus help Koreans heal the wounds inflicted upon them by Japan and give vent to the grudge of the victims.
